Following up on Igor's note, I've upgraded Jetty in HEAD because of 
ill-described possible DoS vulnerability ( 
http://article.gmane.org/gmane.comp.java.jetty.support/4966/match=dos).  
CGI servlet is not enabled in heritrix, the only call to System exec 
done in Jetty according to http://jetty.mortbay.org/jetty/faq/.  While 
trawling the Jetty lists, I came across a note that talks of an attempt 
similar to the one originally reported by Mark 
(http://article.gmane.org/gmane.comp.java.jetty.general/4833/match=vulnerability) 
but disturbingly I cannot reproduce the exact 'WARN!! Alias request 
of..." message in local jetty logs so ain't sure if Jetty is open to 
picking items from the file system.  I dumped all into: 
https://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=990378&group_id=73833&atid=539099.
Yours,
St.Ack

Igor Ranitovic wrote:

>Hi Mark,
>
>  
>
>>just poking through my logs to see what information was 
>>reported there and came across the stuff below. This looks 
>>like an attempt at a buffer overflow attack. Are there any 
>>known jetty venerabilities?
>>    
>>
>
>OSVDB reports that DoS attacks are possible on Jetty 4.2.18 and lower.
>More info at http://www.osvdb.org/displayvuln.php?osvdb_id=4387.
>We are using Jetty 4.2.17 and we should upgrade to the latest stable version (4.2.21).
>Also, there is some mention of CGI security problems in early versions 
>(http://groups.yahoo.com/group/jetty-announce/message/45)
>We don't have Jetty configured to run CGI except if it is a default setting, which I doubt. Even 
>though it is not an issue anymore we will take a look at it.
>
>Take care.
>i.
>
>  
>
>>cheers 
>>
>>mark
